stepTitle: The cost to remove a toxin from a lake is modeled by the function $$C(p)=\frac{75p}{85-p}$$, where C is the cost (in thousands of dollars) and $$p$$ is the amount of toxin in a small lake (measured in parts per billion [ppb]). This model is valid only when the amount of toxin is less than $$85$$ ppb. Find the cost to remove $$25$$ ppb of the toxin from the lake.
